p: Governments and organisations have discovered that COVID‐19 exerts a different impact on people according to their age (see e.g., 19 , 20 , 21 , 22 , 23 ). For instance, the Centres for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC; 2021), as of 18 June 2020, 93% of COVID‐19 death occur are reported in the population over 55 years of age. European Commission 24 reports that 94% of fatalities are uniformly concentrated in the population over 60 years of age, and the case fatality rate (CFR) for all countries is starting to increase after age 50.
